article.headline: Buffalo 82, Kent State 66
article.story: AMHERST N.Y. (AP) -- Daniel Gilbert scored 22 points and Calvin Cage added 18 to lead Buffalo over Kent State 82-66 Wednesday night, ending the Golden Flashes' 10-game winning streak. Buffalo (13-11, 8-7 Mid-American Conference) took command of the game midway through the first half with a 19-4 run and never looked back. Yassin Idbihi scored 16 points and was 4-4 from 3-point range for the Bulls, who won their fourth straight. Turner Battle added 13 points. Bryan Bedford led Kent State (20-4, 13-2 MAC) with 18 points, while Jason Edwin scored 14 and DeAndre Haynes 11. Gilbert keyed the first-half run with a 3-pointer that tied the score at 16. Cage and Idbihi hit back-to-back 3-pointers and Cage capped the spurt with a pair of free throws, making the score 32-20 with 6:03 left in the first half. Buffalo hit seven more 3-pointers in the second half with Cage leading the way with three. The Bulls maintained a double-digit lead for the last 15 minutes. The Golden Flashes, who entered the game No. 1 in the MAC in assist to turnover ratio, committed 16 turnovers compared to just nine assists.
